com.j2speed.async
Interface AsyncRun

public interface AsyncRun

Represents the current execution life cycle of an asynchronous computation.

Author:
Alex Nistico <alienisty(at)gmail.com>

Method Summary
 void cancel()
          Cancels the async.
 boolean isCancelled()
          Whether the asynchronous computation has been cancelled or not.
 boolean isDone()
          Returns true if the asynchronous computation is completed.
 boolean isStarted()
          Whether the computation ever started or not.
 

Method Detail

isStarted

boolean isStarted()
Whether the computation ever started or not.

Returns:
true if started, false otherwise.

cancel

void cancel()
Cancels the async.

isCancelled

boolean isCancelled()
Whether the asynchronous computation has been cancelled or not.

Returns:
true if cancelled, false otherwise.

isDone

boolean isDone()
Returns true if the asynchronous computation is completed. Completion may be due to normal termination, an exception, or cancellation; in all of these cases, this method will return true.

Returns:
true if this task completed
